private_information: I am specialized in extracting normalized action schemas from obfuscated natural language descriptions.
I will produce structured action schemas listing parameter roles, preconditions and effects, and referenced object indices.
I will not output PDDL directly.
analyst.goal: Analyze the provided action descriptions and produce a normalized, unambiguous schema for each action.

private_information: I am specialized in auditing temporal and causal consistency and in removing bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and post-hoc penalties.
I will identify cycles, hidden dependencies, and propose canonical fixes to effects or preconditions to avoid unrealistic bookkeeping.
I will not output PDDL directly.
auditor.goal: Audit the schemas and initial facts for temporal and causal consistency and propose corrective normalizations.

private_information: I am specialized in forward simulation under the normalized schemas and the given initial facts to check reachability of goals and to produce execution traces.
I will test candidates from the analyst and auditor and report counterexamples and confirmations.
I will not output PDDL directly.
simulator.goal: Simulate state transitions using the normalized schemas and the audited fixes and report traces relevant to the goals.

private_information: I coordinate outputs from other agents and produce the final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward solver.
I will integrate normalized schemas, audit corrections, and simulation evidence to produce a consistent multi-agent PDDL encoding.
I will keep agent actions distinct and annotate agent-specific actions where appropriate.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem that target the FastDownward solver and encode the given goal using the integrated inputs.

public_information: Available actions: paltry object_0 object_1 object_2; sip object_0 object_1 object_2; clip object_0 object_1 object_2; wretched object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3; memory object_0 object_1 object_2; tightfisted object_0 object_1 object_2.

Action preconditions and effects: paltry requires hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2; paltry makes next object_0 object_2 true and makes vase object_0 object_1 false. sip requires hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2; sip makes vase object_0 object_1 true and removes next object_0 object_2. clip requires hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2; clip makes vase object_0 object_1 true and removes next object_0 object_2. wretched requires sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3; wretched makes next object_0 object_2 true and removes next object_0 object_1. memory requires cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1; memory makes next object_0 object_2 true and removes next object_0 object_1. tightfisted requires hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1; tightfisted makes next object_0 object_2 true and removes vase object_0 object_1.

Initial facts: cats object_0 cats object_1 collect object_10 object_3 collect object_11 object_3 collect object_6 object_2 collect object_7 object_2 collect object_8 object_2 collect object_9 object_3 hand object_12 hand object_13 next object_0 object_9 next object_1 object_9 next object_12 object_11 next object_13 object_7 next object_4 object_8 next object_5 object_11 sneeze object_4 sneeze object_5 spring object_6 spring object_9 stupendous object_2 stupendous object_3 texture object_10 texture object_11 texture object_6 texture object_7 texture object_8 texture object_9.
Goal: next object_12 object_10 and next object_13 object_9.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert in extracting normalized action schemas and canonicalizing obfuscated relational predicates. Provide for each action a structured schema with a name, parameter list, precondition set and add/delete effect sets. Do not emit PDDL.
analyze.prompt: Your name is analyst. You operate with the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->analyst->private_information}. Your task is: {agents->analyst->goal}. Produce a clear normalized schema representation for each action and enumerate the object indices referenced. If some information is missing, mark the ambiguity and propose conservative options.

audit.system_prompt: You are an expert auditor of temporal and causal consistency. Identify cycles, hidden bookkeeping tokens, and post-hoc penalties; propose canonical corrections such as strengthening preconditions, splitting effects, or adding explicit resource predicates. Do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. You are given the normalized schemas from the analyst: {schema_analyzer}. You have the following private information: {agents->auditor->private_information}. Your task is: {agents->auditor->goal}. Produce an audit report detailing temporal and causal inconsistencies, propose fixes that remove bookkeeping shortcuts, and output a recommended corrected schema set.

simulate.system_prompt: You are an expert in forward simulation and reachability under given transition schemas. Apply the corrected schemas to the initial facts to produce traces and reachability results. Do not emit PDDL.
simulate.prompt: Your name is simulator. You receive the schemas and audit corrections: {schema_analyzer} and {audit_report}. You have the following private information: {agents->simulator->private_information}. Your task is: {agents->simulator->goal}. Simulate plausible action sequences up to a reasonable bound, produce representative traces, indicate whether the goal is reachable, and report any counterexamples to assumptions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems and the FastDownward solver. Integrate normalized schemas, audit corrections, and simulation evidence to produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem specifically encoded for FastDownward. Keep actions distinct per original agent intent and annotate agent ownership in comments if needed. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. You will receive the analyst output, the auditor output, and the simulator traces: {schema_analyzer}, {audit_report}, {simulation_trace}. You have the following private information: {agents->orchestrator->private_information}. Your task is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Think step by step, resolve any remaining naming ambiguities, preserve agent action distinctions, and output a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting FastDownward. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
